data.question: What is the BET surface area of BPV-MOF after postsynthetic metalation with [Ir(COD)(OMe)]2?
How does the Ir loading percentage with respect to Zr centers compare between BPV-MOF-Ir and mBPV-MOF-Ir?
data.answer: BPV-MOF-Ir has 65% Ir loading and mBPV-MOF-Ir has 16% Ir loading with respect to Zr centers.

data.question: What is the effect of removing mPT-MOF-Ir from the reaction mixture on the ortho-silylation of diethyl(hydrido)silyl ether?
data.answer: The ortho-silylation of diethyl(hydrido)silyl ether stopped after removing mPT-MOF-Ir, demonstrating the heterogeneous nature of MOF catalysis.

data.question: What is the yield of 5-(4,4,5,5-tetramethyl-1,3,2-dioxaborolan-2-yl)-m-xylene when mBPV-MOF-Ir is used for the C-H borylation of m-xylene under optimized conditions?
How does the catalytic activity of mPT-MOF-Ir compare to {pth}Ir(COD)(OMe) in the C-H borylation of m-xylene under identical conditions?
data.answer: mPT-MOF-Ir shows higher catalytic activity than {pth}Ir(COD)(OMe) in the C-H borylation of m-xylene, as indicated by faster conversion rates.

data.question: Can TPHN-MOF treated with [Ir(COD)(OMe)]2 catalyze the C-H borylation of benzene?
data.answer: No, TPHN-MOF treated with [Ir(COD)(OMe)]2 did not catalyze the C-H borylation of benzene, ruling out the involvement of Zr-SBU-Ir species in catalytic borylation reactions.

data.question: What is the conversion percentage of B2pin2 to borylated product when mPT-MOF-Ir is used for the C-H borylation of indole?
Is the mPT-MOF-Ir catalyst stable and reusable in the ortho-silylation reaction of arenes?
data.answer: Yes, the mPT-MOF-Ir catalyst is stable and reusable in the ortho-silylation reaction of arenes, as demonstrated by consistent yields in recycle tests.

data.question: What is the BET surface area of mPT-MOF after postsynthetic metalation with [Ir(COD)(OMe)]2?
Does the presence of Ir in BPV-MOF-Ir and mBPV-MOF-Ir affect their thermal stability compared to their non-metalated counterparts?
data.answer: Yes, the presence of Ir in BPV-MOF-Ir and mBPV-MOF-Ir affects their thermal stability, as indicated by the increased residual mass at 600 °C in TGA curves.

data.question: What is the conversion rate of the borylation reaction using mBPV-MOF-Ir as a catalyst for m-xylene?
How does the conversion rate of the borylation reaction using mPT-MOF-Ir compare to using {pth}Ir(COD)(OMe) for m-xylene?
data.answer: mPT-MOF-Ir shows a higher conversion rate than {pth}Ir(COD)(OMe) for the borylation reaction of m-xylene.

data.question: Can TPHN-MOF treated with [Ir(COD)(OMe)]2 catalyze the C-H borylation of benzene?
data.answer: No, TPHN-MOF treated with [Ir(COD)(OMe)]2 did not catalyze the C-H borylation of benzene.

data.question: What is the yield of 2-(4,4,5,5-tetramethyl-1,3,2-dioxaborolan-2-yl)-1H-indole when mPT-MOF-Ir is used for the C-H borylation of indole?
Is the mPT-MOF-Ir catalyst stable and reusable in the C-H borylation reaction of arenes?
data.answer: Yes, the mPT-MOF-Ir catalyst is stable and reusable in the C-H borylation reaction of arenes, as demonstrated by consistent yields in recycle tests.

data.question: What is the BET surface area of mPT-MOF after postsynthetic metalation with [Ir(COD)(OMe)]2?
Does the presence of Ir in BPV-MOF-Ir and mBPV-MOF-Ir affect their thermal stability compared to their non-metalated counterparts?
data.answer: Yes, the presence of Ir in BPV-MOF-Ir and mBPV-MOF-Ir affects their thermal stability, as indicated by the increased residual mass at 600 °C in TGA curves.
